title: Paris Olympics: Duathlon instead of a triathlon? Seine's pollution forces organizers to consider the option
summary: After scrapping training sessions due to heavy rainfall over the weekend, which degraded the quality of the river, Olympics organizers will decide early Tuesday morning whether the men's triathlon event can go ahead as planned.

title: Venezuela protesters teargassed as opposition says it has proof that Maduro lost reelection bid
summary: Opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said  records showed a 'mathematically irreversible' lead for Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia.

title: Paris Olympics: Yazan Al Bawwab, Palestinian swimmer on a mission
summary: The flag-bearer for the Palestinian delegation, who was eliminated from his 100m backstroke on Sunday, is also drawing attention to the tragic fate of his compatriots.

title: UK knife attack: Two children dead, 11 injured in northwest England
summary: Police reported a stabbing at a children's dance class near Liverpool on Monday. A 17-year-old male has been arrested on suspicion of murder and attempted murder in the attack.

title: Biden unveils US Supreme Court reform plans
summary: In an op-ed published in the Washington Post, the US President called for 'three bold reforms to restore trust and accountability to the court and our democracy.' He later cited 'extremism' present in SCOTUS at an address in Texas.

title: Paris 2024: Where are the foreign delegations' Olympic Houses?
summary: Dozens of National Olympic Committees have set up hospitality houses in the capital to celebrate their athletes and showcase their country's culture.

title: Israel weighs retaliation against Hezbollah after deadly Golan Heights attack
summary: In the eyes of the Israeli government, the rocket attack that killed 12 children and wounded 29 in Majdal Shams, a Druze town in the occupied Golan Heights, justifies an uptick in the conflict.

title: Paris Olympics: Opera singers Marina Viotti and Axelle Saint-Cirel float on high after opening ceremony performance
summary: Operatic voices resounded as the two mezzo-sopranos performed on the banks of the Seine in the show orchestrated by Thomas Jolly.

title: Fiber optic networks 'sabotaged' in parts of France
summary: It was not clear whether there was a link with the coordinated attacks that paralyzed the country's high-speed train network last Friday, hours before the opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics : After a scare, all four French surfers qualify for round of 16
summary: Kauli Vaast and Johanne Defay had to go through a second-chance event on Sunday, July 28, to join teammates Vahine Fierro and Joan Duru in qualifying for the round of 16.

title: Paris Olympics: The 'nightmare' elimination of French gymnasts
summary: The French women's team fell apart during qualifications on Sunday, shocked by Marine Boyer's fall on her back moments before they took to the floor.

title: Paris 2024: Léon Marchand's secret to becoming an Olympic champion
summary: Gold medalist in the 400 m individual medley on Sunday, the French swimmer, buoyed by the crowd, had an ideal start to his week. Once again, his performance underwater set him apart from his rivals.

title: In pictures: California megafire ravages acres of forest
summary: Firefighters continue to battle the giant wildfire ravaging northern California, in conditions increasingly conducive to its progression with strengthening winds and rising temperatures.

title: Paris mayor wants to keep Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower after Games
summary: Anne Hidalgo said she also wished to keep the Olympic cauldron and the statues of French women unveiled in the opening ceremony.

title: Japan win Olympic men's gymnastics team gold
summary: Daiki Hashimoto produced a superb performance to get Japan home by just 0.532 points with an overall points tally of 259.594.

title: Israel's Channel 13 fights to keep its independence
summary: The popular TV channel's employees are protesting against the cancellation of star journalist Raviv Drucker's investigative program, an emblematic move by Netanyahu's government to bring the media to heel.

title: US announces $1.7 billion in new security assistance for Ukraine
summary: The assistance will provide Ukraine with several kinds of air defense munitions to protect against Russian strikes.

title: Air France, Lufthansa cancel Beirut flights after Israel vows reprisals over Golan Heights' rocket strike
summary: The French national carrier announced it was suspending flights on Monday and Tuesday due to the 'security situation' in Lebanon.

title: Paris Olympics: Rafael Nadal's defeat marks the end of his reign
summary: The Spaniard was outclassed on Monday by Serb Novak Djokovic (1-6, 4-6). Nadal remains in action in the doubles competition with compatriot Carlos Alcaraz.

title: Terrestrial carbon sinks collapsed in 2023, a stark warning of climate changes to come
summary: Forests and soils only absorbed between 1.5 and 2.6 billion metric tons of CO2 in 2023, far behind the 9.5 billion in 2022, mainly due to drought in the Amazon and fires in Canada and Siberia.

title: Paris Olympics: Will Clarisse Agbégnénou be invincible once more?
summary: In 2021, the French judoka breezed through the Olympic tournament to win gold in the -63 kg category. Although less dominant now, the six-time world champion, who had a baby girl two years ago, still impresses.

title: Japan's airports are on the verge of running out of fuel
summary: The growing shortage is preventing Japanese airports from operating 140 additional flights a week, hampering the country's tourism aspirations.

title: Olympic men's triathlon postponed due to Seine pollution worries
summary: The first sporting event scheduled to take place in the Seine River has been postponed until Wednesday.
